conclusion: Determine the magnitude and direction of the frictional force at t = 2.5 s.
The wire frame is a square with side length 0.2 m, half in a magnetic field directed inward.
The magnetic field B changes with time as B = (3 + 2t) T.
Calculate the area of the wire frame: Area = 0.04 m².
Calculate magnetic flux at t = 2.5 s: Φ = 0.32 Wb.
Calculate rate of change of magnetic flux: dΦ/dt = 0.08 Wb/s.
Determine direction of frictional force: Opposite to Lorentz force.
Final answer: Frictional force is 0.032 N, directed outward.
